result.execSummary:
The defendant Isabel Ortega Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Isabel Ortega Jr was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Isabel Ortega Jr is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Isabel Ortega Jr was found guilty of Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).
  • Isabel Ortega Jr was found guilty of Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).
  • Isabel Ortega Jr was found guilty of 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Isabel Ortega Jr was found guilty of Incest [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.06.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay wil result in a civil jdugment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.  
All Court costs surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence/count.  Credit for 442 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with the victim named in the complaint or her mother; and any person under the age of 18 without approval by his agent.
No further violations of the law to the level of probable cause.

Mental health assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
DOC offender reentry programing.  Cooperate with any follow up deemed necessary by the probation department.
Sex offender treatment assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Lifetime sex offender registry.  Comply with all terms of the registry.
Follow all rules of supervision. 
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

superTimeConds.notes: If physically able.  Not with children.

supervisions.notes: Court advised dendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isabel Ortega in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Defendant Isabel Ortega in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge Borowski for Judge Donald.
State has complied with victim notification.    PSI reviewed and corrections made.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Enestina O.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  22 YEARS with 442 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 16 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 YEARS.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 17 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 11 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 YEARS.

As to Count 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

As to Count 5:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Mental health assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- DOC offender re-entry programming and cooperate with any follow up deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Sex offender treatment assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Lifetime sex offender registry, comply with all terms of the registry.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment.
- If physically able, complete 500 hours of community service, not with children.
- No contact with: the victim named in the complaint, or her mother & any person under the age of 18 without approval by his agent.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- No further violations of the law to the level of probable cause.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Letters in Support of the Defendant
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 687

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE DONALD.....
Defendant Isabel Ortega in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Defendant Isabel Ortega in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 At the hour of 4:54 PM, the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict as follows:

Count 1:  Not Guilty
Count 2:  GUILTY
Count 3:  GUILTY
Count 4:  GUILTY
Count 5:  GUILTY

which was then read.  
Court polled and discharged the jury.  
Verdict received and filed.  
Jury out of box at 4:59 PM.

Court granted State's motion for judgment on verdict as to Count #s 2, 3, 4, and 5 AND denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict as to Count #s 2, 3, 4, and 5.  

Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to Count #s 2, 3, 4, and 5.

Court ordered Count #1 DISMISSED.

**Upon defense's request, Court ordered an "expedited" PSI.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case adjourned to 05-31-2016 at 10:00 AM - Courthouse, Rm. 635 Judge Conen's Court (before Judge Borowski) for Sentencing Hearing.
